page.title: 18Education in Pontyclun
page.content: In 1878 the National School was built in School Street.The Church of England held its services there.Their Vicar was the Vicar of Llantrisant.The School was also the centre of social life.As the population grew,the"iron school" was built.It was made of iron and it was built where the netball court is now,in 1913 and 1914.The present school was built in 1923.A motto was engraved on one of the walls - it says - "Dring yn uchel,dring yn uwch" which translated is - "Climb high,climb higher".In 1970 the three outside classrooms were built.As the population grew an infants school was built in November 1973.Mr.Howard Thomas became Headmaster of the Junior School and Miss Felicia Thomas,J.P., became Headmistress of the Infants School.
